summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York for the date August 9, 2019. The sheets record staff observations of inmates in locked-down status, following a protocol requiring checks at least twice per hour. The document is significant as it represents the type of routine monitoring in place at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

events.title: Routine Inmate Monitoring at MCC NY SHU
events.description: Staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York's Special Housing Unit conducted 30-minute observational checks on inmates in continuous locked-down status throughout the day and night.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit dated August 9, 2019.
It details a strict protocol requiring staff to observe inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The sheets are divided by watch (Morning, Day, Evening) and tier (L-Tier, M-Tier, ZA Tier-J, ZA Tier-K, ZA Tier-G, ZA Tier-H, ZB).
Each check includes a time frame and a signature block, indicating the observation was documented.
The document is part of the Epstein case files, indicating it relates to the facility where he was incarcerated.
